data.title: Cardboard Crust
data.text: We have heard good things about the pizza so at a recent backyard get together we ordered some pizza for delivery.  Very disappointed.  Price was way more than other options, which is ok if it's good, but it was not.  The crust was like cardboard. Sorry to say, but not for us.

data.title: BEST Pizza!!!
data.text: We came to D'Amores for the first time on a field trip with my son's Kindergarten class and ever since then it has been our favorite place for pizza!!  It is a bit farther from home from our old favorite pizza place but well worth the trip!  They import their flour from Italy and I don't know why, but it just makes the crust so delicious!  The people here REALLY care about making good Italian food.

data.title: Some say best in the area
data.text: Had to try this spot for pizza. I had heard from multiple sources it was the place to get pizza in the Conejo Valley. Despite it being a bit pricey, I can see why everyone loves it. It seems small and family owned but the service was excellent and the order was ready as expected and as ordered. The ingredients were fresh and the sauce was very flavorful. I am eager to try their other menu options next time.

data.title: Delicious delivery
data.text: We were too tired to go out, so we looked up relatively local restaurants that deliver, saw that this one had good ratings, at least for pizza, but having had pizza recently, ordered a variety of pastas to be delivered. They arrived in the estimated time, one hour, and we're still warm enough not to need heating. And every dish was delicious! The entrees came with side salads and delicious, warm garlic buns.

data.title: tasty pizza and salads
data.text: One of my wife's favorite places.  Great pizza and salad lunch special.  Cozy place to eat with friendly staff

data.title: Love The Pizza
data.text: We love the food and find it amazing for a fast-casual restaurant! Their pizza is my favorite in our area! And you don't feel that guilty because their pizza is much healthier than most!

data.title: Pizza to dream about
data.text: I was brought up on New York / New Jersey pizza and have eaten some of the best pizza in my time that was till I moved to California; Pizza was hit and miss, I was never satisfied till one evening by chance I decided to have pizza at D'Amore's. Their Pizza is by far the best I have eaten. The dough, tomato sauce and cheese are top quality and it is cooked to perfection. They accommodate request and make the pizza to you order. Try the eggplant it 's excellent.  My Wife and I eat there almost every week.

data.title: Pizza that are less in Calories...
data.text: My daughter's school arranged this field trip to restaurant last week. The owner was well prepared to handle the crowd of around 25-30 kids with parents. The kids were all give a colorful chef hat made out of paper. The owner gave a demo on making the pizza and I was shocked to know that Costco pizza had around 700 Cal in one slice of pizza while pizzas made here had only 160 Calories. She kept the kids engaged while the pizzas were being baked by giving them a coloring activity and telling stories. Most of the major ingredients used in making pizzas were imported from Italy. My daughter enjoyed making her own pizza with her choice of toppings. The pizza tasted yummy too. I am not sure if prior reservations are needed.

data.title: Great Thin Crust Pizza
data.text: I have eaten at several of their locations and the Pizza is always fantastic.  And the good thing to know about them is their pizza is much lighter in calories and fat than any other chain out there.  So if you are watching your waist line and think that pizza is just to fatteneing to have, go there and enjoy!

data.title: Not impressed
data.text:
I was not impressed at all with the pizza. I went with a friend who had heard rave reviews. We did not think it was anything special.
Service was slow.

data.title: I am IN LOVE with D'Amore's, the only pizza place in the Ventura/LA area that I've found that can make thin East...
data.text: I am IN LOVE with D'Amore's, the only pizza place in the Ventura/LA area that I've found that can make thin East Coast-style pizza right. So delizioso. Great chopped spinach salad too.

data.title: Good pie at a decent price.  Some of the best around.
data.text: Good pie at a decent price.  Some of the best around.
